page.title: 09Winchfield Area - Farming.
page.content: There were once 14 farms in the block but the land is now distributed among 8 farms as follows:-{Church House {Farm, Hitches Farm}(100ha),{Hurst Farm (146ha),{Taplins Farm}(77ha),{Pale {Lane Farm}(24ha) ,{New Court Farm (56ha) - part of Trimmers Farm, Hook & {Vale Farm}is just a few hectares. {Tudor Farm Cottage}has 13ha. To the south of the block are parts of{Green- {ways Farm, Swans Farm, New Barn Farm & {Pilcot Farm.}The block is divided fairly evenly between grazing & crops. {Livestock}is largely dairy cows but there are also beef cattle, sheep, pigs & goats. The grazing land is intensively farmed being cut twice a year for hay/silage. The{main crops are Wheat, Oats, Barley, Maize & Kale & the block is able to boast an acre of grape-vines! Some of the larger farms own all their machinery.
